meanings.definition: Able to be touched or felt.
meanings.sent1: The soft fur of the kitten was palpable to my fingertips.
meanings.sent2: The rough texture of the tree bark was palpable against my palm.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the air was so palpable, you could almost touch it.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a heavy blanket weighing down on us.
meanings.sent5: The fear in her voice was palpable, sending shivers down my spine.

meanings.sent1: The happiness on her face was palpable to everyone around.
meanings.sent2: The disappointment in his eyes was palpable to all who saw him.
meanings.sent3: The confusion in the room was so palpable, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The tension between them was palpable, like a thick fog in the room.
meanings.sent5: The relief in his voice was palpable, like a weight lifted off his shoulders.

meanings.sent1: The mistake in the report was palpable to anyone who read it.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project was palpable to everyone involved.
meanings.sent3: The joy in the room was so palpable, it was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The tension between them was palpable, like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The determination in her eyes was palpable, driving her towards her goal.
